I remember me and my cousin discovering this Lego Comic at the Toy Store when we were kids and as we each had our allowances on us, we each snagged and picked up a copy of the comic for ourselves. So the thrill as kids being able to use our own money instead of begging parents and something we wanted that wasn't spent on candy was well worth it.
I still have that comic too after all these years. As a comic geared towards kids, it had some good art work and holds a fun little story making use of settings and characters from the Pirate Theme.

The comic came with two minifigures, the red capped pirate youth Will and the pirate first mate wearing the brown tricorne hat Rummy. So now aside from Redbeard himself, you have two other named minifigures for the Pirate theme. The Leader for the Imperial Army in the Eldorado Fort is also named, Broadside.

The game presented at the back of the comic was worth building at least once and playing out a couple times between me and my cousin. It was fairly standard roll dice, move forward, get to the end. But it gave the comic a bit more depth and something of an activity after words as we
column2: tried to build the game board from our own lego pieces.

column1:
It'd be fun and great if some more comics and books in this style where a minifigure or two are included came out. And the few that I do see in the Brickset archieves look good, such as two for Atlantis are either unpublished or those who've bought them, aren't reselling. So probably better marketing to announce the comics/books are there.
